page.title: 05ACCIDENTS ON THE A435.
page.content: The A435 Cheltenham to Cirencester road is particularly dangerous. The police have kindly provided us with the following figures to emphasise this. There have been 29 road traffic accidents during the period between April 1984 and April 1985. Only 2 of them were fatal, 1 in Colesbourne and 1 in Perrott's Brook. In 4 of the accidents there were serious injuries, 8 produced slight injuries and in 15 there were no injuries. The traffic census provided by the police for the A435 shows that between 08.00 and 09.00 the road is very busy. About 370 vehicles pass during the period. This figure decreases until between 17.00 and 18.00 when it rises to about 380. At weekends the road is much quieter during these periods.
